QuestionStem: Which of the following statements correctly describe the formation of wind? Select all that apply.

options.AnswerText: A. As air cools, its particles move closer together, increasing its density.
B. As air cools, its particles move further apart, leading to decreased density.
C. Cool air sinks, causing higher air pressure.
D. Cool air rises, causing lower air pressure.
E. The cold air spreads out, causing the warm air, which has a higher air pressure, to sink.
F. The cold air spreads out, causing the warm air, which has a lower air pressure, to rise.

CorrectFeedback: As air cools, its particles move closer together, causing high air pressure. The cool air sinks and causes the warm air, which has lower air pressure, to rise. This movement of air particles from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure is wind.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Recall that dense air is cooler and exerts more pressure than less dense air.
IncorrectFeedback: Recall that dense air is cooler and exerts more pressure than less dense air.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: As air cools, its particles move closer together, causing high air pressure. The cool air sinks and causes the warm air, which has lower air pressure, to rise. This movement of air particles from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure is wind.
